craterdog.notary

Class V1NotarizationProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • craterdog.notary.V1NotarizationProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Notarization

    public final class V1NotarizationProvider
extends Object
implements Notarization
    This class can be used to sign and verify digital notarized documents using a private/public key pair. It uses RSA-2048 for asymmetric (public/private) key signature generation and verification.
    Author:
    Derk Norton

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String hashingAlgorithm
      The hashing algorithm used to generate hash values for the documents.
      int majorVersion
      The major version number of the implementation of this digital notary.
      int minorVersion
      The minor version number of the implementation of this digital notary.
      String signingAlgorithm
      The signing algorithm used to sign and verify the documents.

      • Fields inherited from interface craterdog.notary.Notarization

        VALID_FOR_FOREVER, VALID_FOR_ONE_DAY, VALID_FOR_ONE_HOUR, VALID_FOR_ONE_MINUTE, VALID_FOR_ONE_MONTH, VALID_FOR_ONE_WEEK, VALID_FOR_ONE_YEAR

      This method generates a new notary key consisting of an asymmetric (public/private) key pair based on the algorithm implemented by the specific notary implementation.
      Watermark generateWatermark(int secondsToLive)
      This method generates a watermark defining the lifetime of a new document as well as the version of the algorithm used to sign and verify the document.
      NotarySeal notarizeDocument(String documentType, String document, NotaryKey notaryKey)
      This method generates a digital seal from the specified document using the specified private notary key.

      This method serializes, as a JSON string, the specified notary key encrypting the private signing key using the specified password.

      This method checks to see if there are any errors and throws a validation exception containing the errors if there are.

      This method validates a notary certificate using the previous notary certificate associated with the notary key that certified it.

      This method checks to see if the watermark is still valid.

        public Watermark generateWatermark(int secondsToLive)
        Description copied from interface: Notarization
        This method generates a watermark defining the lifetime of a new document as well as the version of the algorithm used to sign and verify the document.
        Specified by:
        generateWatermark in interface Notarization
        Parameters:
        secondsToLive - The number of seconds the document should be valid from the current date and time.
        Returns:
        The newly generated watermark.

                                 char[] password)
        Description copied from interface: Notarization

        Specified by:

      • deserializeNotaryKey

        public NotaryKey deserializeNotaryKey(String json,
                                      char[] password)
                               throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Notarization
        This method de-serializes, from a JSON string, a notary key using the specified password to decrypt the signing key.
        Specified by:
        deserializeNotaryKey in interface Notarization
        Parameters:
        json - The JSON string representing the notary key.
        password - The password to be used to decrypt the signing key.
        Returns:
        The reconstituted notary key.
        Throws:
        IOException - The notary key could not be deserialized.

      • validateDocument

        public void validateDocument(String document,
                             NotarySeal seal,
                             NotaryCertificate certificate,
                             Map<String,Object> errors)
        Description copied from interface: Notarization
        This method uses the specified public verification key to verify that the specified digital seal is valid for the specified document.
        Specified by:
        validateDocument in interface Notarization
        Parameters:
        document - The notarized document to be verified.
        seal - The digital seal for the document.
        certificate - The verification certificate of the notary that signed the document.
        errors - A map containing any errors that were found.

        public void throwExceptionOnErrors(String messageTag,
                                   Map<String,Object> errors)
                            throws ValidationException
        Description copied from interface: Notarization
        This method checks to see if there are any errors and throws a validation exception containing the errors if there are.
        Specified by:
        throwExceptionOnErrors in interface Notarization
        Parameters:
        messageTag - The message resource tag for the validation exception.
        errors - The map of errors (and empty map means no errors).
        Throws:
        ValidationException - There were errors in the errors map.
